Feitong's Vision Place

Think seriously!

What is perception?

A constructive process that makes best guess of physical world.
Does this sentence really makes sense? Formularize it. Do Experiments.

What is attention?

Seems to be a selecting mechanism.
Select what? How to select?

What is consciousness?

An illusion? No! Maybe a presentation
What do you mean by "a presentation". Is it a thing?

Be Honest!

Ok. I DON'T KNOW!.

Identity

\ī-ˈden-tə-tē\ noun.

Id-entity, the existence of id?

My name is Feitong Yang.
You don't know me.
Neither do I.

I am a Ph.D. Student

By Ph.D I mean Positive, Happy and Dynamic which should be pronounced as Pessimistic, Hazardous, and Dreadful.

I do science for fun

This is FT's whimsical first principle of doing research or precisely speaking, I do science only when I feel happy.

I also do weird things

So my explanation of words, like Id-entity, makes little sense. I watch ANIME, travel some places, read some books, and program some codes, and do other random stuff that I cannot categorize.

Maybe a bit more details

That's why I made this CV, to satisfy curiosities, both yours and mine.

Research

\ri-ˈsərch\ verb.

Re-search, search again and again?

Unknow known, Unknow Unkown.
Know Known, Know Unknown.
I don't know

General Description

Obssessed by visual experience, generating hypotheses of computations, aiming at reverse engineering the cognitive algorithms, armed with psychophysics, acquring weapons of computational modeling, tempted to reaching neuroimaging.

Projects Publication List

Visual Crowding

Why peripheral vision suffers from crowding effects? Do our visual experiences and environmental statistics play a role?

Visual Similarity

Why we say A is similar to B? How we represent and compute visual similarities? How similarity affects our perception and attention?

Statistical Learning

Exposed to hidden statistical regularities, observers can automatically extract those relationships. Why we do that? What is the nature of this learning process?

Memory and Perception

What makes our conscious perception? Oh, yes, physical stimuli, and long-term experiences. What about short-term visual trace that disappears for seconds or minutes?

\ˈrē-ˌsȯrs\ noun.

Re-source, orgin back?

Information is out there.
Either you can't find it.
Or you won't read it.
